Using CJS and JS. JS -> for population estimates. CJS -> for time-dependent survival and recapture rates of a given species 
  

```{r}
data(dipper)
str(dipper)
print(dipper)
```


```{r}
library(unmarked)
library(marked)
library(RMark)
library(ggplot2)

cap <- read.csv("capturehistory2.csv", stringsAsFactors = F)
str(cap)
print(cap)
```

```{r}
cap.y <- cap[,c("c1", "c2", "c3", "c4" , "c5", "c6", "c7", "c8", "c9", "c10", "c11")] #was doing this based on the N-mixture model, but not sure if it's really what I want to do
```

```{r}
data(cap)
cap$ch <- as.character(cap$ch) #trying to make ch characters because of error "Error in strsplit(data$ch, "") : non-character argument"
model=crm(cap)
model
model=cjs.hessian(model)
model
```



```{r}
mod=crm(cap,model="JS",groups="Sex",model.parameters=list(Phi=list(formula=~Sex),p=list(formula=~code)))
mod$results$beta #found online but not sure how to use it
```
